title: Safe Insect Selection for Food
brief: Identify which insects are safe to eat and which to avoid for emergency nutrition.
steps: Step 1: AVOID all adults that sting or bite (wasps, bees, hornets).
Step 2: AVOID hairy insects or brightly colored insects.
Step 3: AVOID caterpillars and insects with strong, pungent odors.
Step 4: AVOID spiders and disease carriers like ticks, flies, and mosquitoes.
Step 5: Look for insects in rotting logs: ants, termites, beetles, and grubs.
Step 6: Search grassy fields where insects are easily visible.
Step 7: Check under stones, boards, and materials on the ground for nesting insects.
Step 8: Remove wings and barbed legs from hard-shelled insects like beetles and grasshoppers before eating.
warnings: Cook hard-shelled insects (beetles, grasshoppers) before eating as they may have parasites.
Never eat brightly colored insects as they are often poisonous.
Avoid insects near contaminated areas or garbage.
